preface.title: Preface
preface.para: Welcome, and thank you for using GMAT! This User GuideTraining Manual contains a wealth of material to introduce you to GMAT and how it works. It also provides an extensive Reference Guide that contains data on every resource, command, and major subcomponent in the system.

section.para: The section provides general information on GMAT and how to use it.
See for a brief project and software overview, including project status, licensing, and contributors.
The section describes how to get and install GMAT, how to run the provided samples, and where to turn for further help.
The is an in-depth guide through some of the key interface features, including the Resources tree, Mission tree, Command Summary, and Script Editor.

note.para: We consider the section to be essential reading, as it describes some fundamental aspects of how GMAT works.

section.para: The section contains give in-depth tutorials that show you how to use GMAT for end-to-end analysis. The tutorials are designed to teach you how to use GMAT in the context of performing real-world analysis and are intended to take between 30 minutes and several hours to complete. Each tutorial has a difficulty level and an approximate duration listed with any prerequisites in its introduction, and are arranged in a general order of difficulty.

The contains individual topics that describe each of GMAT's resources and commands in detail, including its syntax, options, variable ranges and data types, defaults, and expected behavior. It also includes system-level references that describe the script language syntax, parameter listings, external interfaces, and configuration files.

section.title: Typographical Conventions
section.para: This document uses two typographical conventions throughout:

listitem.para: Graphical user interface (GUI) elements and resource and command names are presented in bold.
Filenames, script examples, and user input are presented in monospace.
